1.content:
It was just encroaching on 150 years in the state the Death found himself in. After the battle his thousand years of living had come to an end. It was a new thing for him to experience, so he wasn’t really sure what to expect. He thought he would be free after 100 years, but alas he wasn’t. He was too big, heavy, and sturdy to move. So the army that conquered Shadow Valley had left him there. To be fair, they didn’t conquer them in the slaughter definition that is implied.

There were too few of the Forbidden tribe to protect Shadow Valley. Even for all their advancements and powers, another battle like that would genocide them. Even if they considered it, Death was no longer there to help. So, by order of King Butch, the Forbidden Tribe was no more. All research and samples of material that was too advanced for this age was destroyed. He had bred a kingly conscience, finally, and didn’t want the Forbidden Tribe’s power to be used by the thrones of men. Such a thing would only insight more war and more bloodshed. The only exceptions to this was the items made for immediate and personal use. Such as enchanted swords and armor. But anything that created them and any notes to duplicate the process were destroyed.

In the time that followed; items, people, and other attachments to the Forbidden Tribe were spread out. Some went to live among normal men from beggars, disguised as such while living a lavish life. All the way to Deities, Elementals and such were mostly in this particular group. Some went to the king and offered to serve as teachers. Such as an Archmage in their magic learning schools, or a trainer of their soldiers, and so on. As for the items that were spread out over that time, they were fought over if they were to roam among men.

However, as Death had turned into a statue of Sinc, it was literally impossible to wretch any of his items off of him. No one could move him and no one could do… well… anything to him. Unfortunately that also meant save him from his current state, for those that wanted to. So he stood there for all to see and a trophy of a battle, rather than the actual truth behind the matter. If any that gazed at him actually knew who he was and what he did, they might’ve looked at him differently. It was then that the powers at be decided to banish this… statue of Death, so no more uprisings of super powered people would come to pass. The decision was made and their mages found a way to send him to another world, time, and place.

“Why is this so important?” Asked a well-dressed and robed man. The robes were clearly marked with the mage’s symbol on it. Guards known as Clerics were stationed around to keep them inline. To be honest, Mages were never let out of the schools that they taught. But this order was from the King’s command so… certain allowances were given.

“Other than this thing giving off enough magical energy to destroy half our known land mass… because the King ordered us to do it.” The other Mage said. He was wearing a better robe and as such probably had a better station within the Mages.

“I suppose… Apologies Sir.” Said the mage as he got back to work.

“How long will this thing take?” Asked a cranky old man in full armor. He was the highest ranking Cleric there at the moment and was obviously not thrilled about watching a few dozen unshackled Mages wield magic in the open. Even if Clerics could resist magic, they couldn’t negate it if these mages wanted to escape. But the bluff that he could was probably the only thing keeping the Mages there… that and the threat of being killed when recaptured.

“Only a few more moments sir.” The head mage stated as they finished incantations, circles, and other precautions. “This is a very complex piece of magic…”

“Yeah, Yeah.” The Cleric interrupted with a hateful glare. “Just get it done and let us be on our way back to the tower, where you… People, belong.” The word ‘people’ being strained.

In a hurried few moments, they were all ready and chanting a combination of spells and using the prepared items. Slowly, the statue started to dim, as if the very fabric of time and space were being effected itself. Like a picture slowly getting out of focus was the image of the statue being sent away. The chanting continued as a dozen staffs shooting spells at the statue, as if shoving the statue into the next world. An apt description regarding what they were trying to do. The very sky was distorted as the magic coming from the Death Statue was being shoved into the next world with it. Like a funnel, the effects that had plagued the area were being drained away. With a final spell from all involved, the Statue was gone and the Magic ceased.

“Very good, now let’s get going.” The Cleric demanded, perhaps too soon. He had to push his authority while the mages were obviously still tired out from the ordeal. If he was lucky, he would get them all back before any of them got any ideas to start trouble. But his mission was half over, so there was that…

As for Death, he was watching the whole thing. Just because he was a statue now, didn’t mean that he couldn’t see what was going on. See, but not change it. However, that changed as he entered the new world. Like hitting reset on a computer, his statue form was beginning to break apart and he was becoming free. Unfortunately, his ability wasn’t active while a statue. So he had no idea how to get back. But he had watched the mages and could possibly replicate the process, given enough time. For now he was being set free in a brand new world. Fully powered and ready to do something other than just stand around, like he had done for 150 years.

But where was he???
1.title: Sending Death away.

12.content:
As his skin and other parts of him cracked and went back to normal there were black clouds starting to form around him. He didn't have much control over that. He was at full power until he was fully free, at which point he could seal a high majority of his power. He waited, knowing full well that the darkening sky, the intense gravity, and the atmospheric effects of his power would attract people around him. Like he predicted, when he was all done and the last of the Sinc left his body, there was an explosion of power that shot up into the sky like a beam of black energy that only served to make mini earth quakes and make the sky even blacker than it already was. However, he quickly moved to remedy this. After the initial energy spike; he dematerialized his swords, transformed into is 'Kamper' form, and started otherwise sealing his power. In the course of a few minutes he was all sealed and exhausted. But even him being completely sealed and exhausted was still stronger than normal humans. So, with his training equipment on and his power more or less sealed, he started walking.

"You can stop right there!" Said a voice from behind him.

Of course he had sense people coming, and knew he was there. But for appearances he did as he was told. But that was about all he could do at the moment. He was hoping to get to a hidden spot before taking a rest. Sealing his power was not something that was easy to do, or something that left him particularly energized. On top of that, he had used a considerable amount of energy in the battle before being turned into that statue. He was not going to stand much longer. So he slowly turned to get a glimpse of the person belonging to the voice.

The man was average height compared to Kamper and dressed in full ninja gear, hand in a pocket on his back with weapons in it. Kamper looked around to see the crater he had made when going to full power. It wasn't near as big as it normally was. But it was still a few hundred feet in diameter. This new comer had every right to be nervous about him. So, with that, Kamper dropped and was out. He figured, there was no use fighting this person, especially if he had decimated some of the forest in his home. So the easiest way to get to talk with whomever was in charge would be to be carried to a place that they perceived as safe, and right here wasn't it.

Who is there when he wakes up?
12.title: Naruto

choices: She leaves and returns with someone else.
She has him jailed as a potential security risk.
122.content:
Author’s note: In case you haven’t read the book. He is established as the name “Death” when he is normal and released, “Kamper” when he is in his sealed form.

Kamper woke as he usually does. He didn’t give any signs that he was awake. Not even his breathing was different then when someone is out. He simply observed his surroundings so he knew what he was waking into. This didn’t take him long as nothing was overly complicated, to him. He was laying in what appeared to be a medical housing of some kind. He had his own room, but there were many rooms in the place and many sick and/or injured people there. From what he could tell, the people there constantly in battle. A high majority however were not injured in any other way but the physical. This was a bit of comfort. Physical injuries was not something new to him, nor were the remedies that were being used to save them. This would make his interacting with this world that much easier. He didn’t want to be falling over sick every time someone did something in his direction. Just outside his room were some of the more healthy and physically fit people that were in the immediate area. He didn’t have much time, as one of them, the female, came into the room. He thought about disappearing for a while. But there was no need. They didn’t seem like they could do him any lasting damage. So he waited until she was in the room and looking over him before moving.

“You can stop faking now…” She said after a few moments of idleness.

“Impressive….” Kamper responded simply. Not that he thought the act was overly impressive, but the fact that someone as low leveled as her could see through it. With that he sat up and put his back against the headboard so he could more formally speak with her.

“I am a highly trained Medical Ninja, it shouldn’t be surprising that I can tell if you are sleeping or not.” She said back, slightly put off. Kamper could see that she had a short fuse a good part of the time. She stopped, as if giving him time to speak. When he didn’t, she continued, “Do you know where you are?”

“No.” was his simple answer.

In truth, he knew his surroundings from his limited observation. Heck, he could tell when the nearest apple on a tree was ready and about to fall onto the ground. But he didn’t know there terminology. Sure he could read their minds easy enough. But he knew very little on how insulting that would be, or if they could detect such a thing. So he figured that the answers would come soon enough and he could wait.

“You are in a leaf village hospital.” She informed, taking a moment to gauge if he understood. But he looked concentrated but otherwise blank. She couldn’t read him like most. She let a little time lapse for the usual, ‘why am I here?’ and ‘what happened to me?’ questions that usually came about from being told a person is in the hospital. But he said nothing and seemed content just sitting there, observing her. “Do you know who you are, and what happened?”

“Yes.” Came another simple answer.

“Well, then you know more about you than we do. Feel like sharing?” She asked.

“No.” Kamper stated back.

“Well that would be rude to not even give your name… then again, I haven’t given mine either. So why don’t we do this right, with introductions; I am Lady Tsunade, Fifth Hokage…” She replied then addressed more formally.

“Kamper, Titan.” Kamper replied back.

“Titan? Is that your last name or a rank of some kind?” She asked. He didn’t need to ask what ‘Hokage’ meant. From her emphasis on the word and demeanor, it was safe to assume that she was the leader of at least the village in which he currently resided in.

“Rank.” He answered, again more simply than she preferred. Most ninja were good at perceiving information from the most simple questions. But he was, to her slight annoyance, not giving her anything to perceive.

“Do you mind if I ask you some potentially personal questions?” She asked back.

“No.” he answered.

“Ok, if you really do remember what happened, then can you please tell me what or who made that crater that you were found in?” She asked, seemingly starting things off slow.

“I did.” He replied back.

“You did?! How did you manage that?” She asked, slightly surprised but half expecting the answer.

“Easily.” Kamper answered.

“Look, I just need to know if that is going to happen here. So I need a little more information than a one word answer. I will not risk all the lives I am responsible for over your secrecy.” She stated and asked at the same time.

“Are you going to try and kill me?” Kamper asked.

“No, why would we do that?” She asked back.

“Then you have no problem.” Kamper responded.

“Ok, we’ll get back to that later… When they brought you in here, no one could help you. We tried different medical things to help you, this is a hospital after all. But everything didn’t work. No matter how powerful the jutsu or medicine, your body wouldn’t allow us to work. We’ve never seen something like that before. Can you explain?” She asked.

“I am a Titan. Wither you believe in such things is not my concern. What matters is that one doesn’t reach that rank by being any form of weak.” Kamper replied. Inside he smirked a little bit. If they were having a hard time penetrating your skin, body, and mind now. Just imagine what it would be like when he transforms… if he transforms.

“What about your clothes? We had to take them off in our attempt to treat you. We’ve never seen anything like them. Our most advanced methods can’t even scratch them…?” She asked, trying to get him to answer at least some of the questions in a way that made sense to her.

“They are made of Dragon’s hide and lining. The likelihood of you being able to damage them is highly unlikely.” Kamper said, not even caring that his armor was not with him. This also didn’t make much sense to her. Why would he not be concerned about such prized armor being taken from him.

“Don’t you feel like you want them back?” She asked, trying to get some emotion out of him.

“No. They will return to me when I need them.” Kamper replied without a care about the subject.
122.title: Lady Tsunade

choices: They move forward and torture Kamper.
Kamper has had enough and frees himself.
1223.content:
The conversation was going nowhere as far as revealing information. So, Lady Tsunade did what most would do in their position. Since she couldn’t determine if he was a security risk, she put him in jail as a security risk until proven otherwise. To be fair, leave a close to one mile crater when he arrived didn’t do him any favors and made sense why they thought he was a security risk. So after being placed in a cell, he was taken from there to a room and put in a contraption that left only his head exposed. This was their ‘intel division’ responsible for getting information out of people like him. However, unlike Kamper’s way or reading and digging through minds, their way was less refined and rather harmful.

“Making entry.” They all said as the ninja entered Kamper’s mind.

Kamper was only introduced to a man called ‘Ibiki’ and he was apparently their top information retrieval expert. He certainly looked the part. But Kamper wasn’t worried. If other Titans and demons couldn’t penetrate his mind, they sure would have a hard time. As they entered, rather than an open space to look through with a brain to enter, there was a vastly open space with a man standing in the center. They approached to address him.

“What is this?” They asked, both out of his mind and inside, asking themselves and the figure before them. Unknown to them, this was Death’s released form, guarding his mind from intruders.

“Why have you come here?” came his voice as he opened the eye that wasn’t covered with the eye patch.

“We have come to find this mind’s secrets.” Said the one that seemed to be the one in charge.

“Mortals are not welcome here.” Death said to them, not flinching at the slightest.

“We can’t leave with nothing. If we can’t see into his mind, will you answer questions for us?” The lead ninja asked.

“Very well, however, be warned. Tread lightly, I do not suffer nor fear infants of arrogance and ignorance.” Death said as a clear warning.

“What is your name?” The ninja asked.

“I have 2 names. My real name is tied to this form. I am known as ‘Death’. The form you are currently holding in restraints is known as ‘Kamper’.” Death answered.

“Really? Interesting… What purpose do you have here?” He asked.

“None. I was sent here from another world, one of which I am incapable of returning to. I have yet to establish any form of desire one way or another.” Death replied.

“You said to the Hokage, that you are a Titan. What is that exactly?” He asked.

“A Titan is a being that judges those who would proclaim themselves as ‘gods’. A Titan, in a sense, is the ultimate power of fear to those that wish to have others bow and worship them. As these ‘gods’ tend to be overly powerful, a Titan must be that much more powerful.” Death replied.

“And how powerful are you? You don’t seem like you know any jutsu, but the entrance you made makes us nervous.” The ninja replied.

“I have much to learn.” Death replied.

“You know, answering like that only makes it harder on yourself. We just want security and you aren’t helping.” He responded back, slightly annoyed.

“I am answering each of your questions with the bare truth. Most of my explanations wouldn’t make sense to you. So I am simplistic, using terms you understand.” Death answered.

“Fine, earlier you said ‘mortals’, does that mean you are… immortal?” He asked.

“Yes.” Death answered. The three before him looked at each other in slight shock. “I tire of this.”

With that said he released a seemingly small amount of energy, expelling them from his mind. He opened his eye as Kamper, outside of his mind to address the room of shocked ninja.

“Question me here or in my mind, there is little difference.” Kamper said sternly.

“You seem to think that you are in control, you are mistaken. We WILL get the information we seek, with or without your help.” Said the one called Ibiki.

“Careful sir, we haven’t learned much but what we have learned is that he is immortal. I wouldn’t underestimate him.” Said the other ninja that was in your mind for a time.
1223.title: She has him jailed as a potential security risk.

choices: They take Kamper to a more... hospitable location and continue.
12231.content:
It seemed that they had enough of questioning him. All the jutsus had no effect on him, and those that looked like they worked, he did things that rendered them useless. Like putting him in an unconscious state, he just woke up when he felt like it. So they went elsewhere to discuss. Kamper could feel them and was able to eavesdrop from the vibrations they were making. He was still hesitant about reading their minds however. Eventually, they came back in with the Hokage.

“So, from what my people have told me, you have told them and done some interesting things… and we still can’t make any sense of your equipment. Is it fair to assume that you are just toying with us?” Lady Tsunade asked.

“That would be an apt conclusion. I have nowhere to go, so I’ve been playing your little game.” Kamper responded. Calling the torture, jailing, and questioning a game was not something that they were accustomed to. They obviously had a fairly high opinion of themselves and their abilities.

“Game? I wouldn’t want to be in the shoes you have been in for the last few weeks.” Tsunade replied.

“Let me be clear then.” Kamper said.

Kamper was still in a contraption that was basically encasing him in stone. No normal human would dream of breaking it. But Kamper just stood up, as if the steel and rock holding him were nothing but wet tissue paper. He walked out of the mess and stood before a very shocked group. He didn’t even take any of his training equipment off, not that they could see them to take them off anyway. However, to the onlooker, he was wearing nothing but a pair of underwear. That didn’t last long, as he held out his arms, as if someone was about to dress him. Then, his armor started to come back to him, as if the shadows themselves were bringing him his clothes and redressing him. The shadows went back into the corners after he was fully dressed and in his armor.

“If I didn’t want to be here and listen to you, I wouldn’t be.” Kamper said with a slight glare, openly challenging them and materializing the Death sword on his back.

“H-how did you do that?” Tsunade exclaimed and asked as she and the others came out of the shock of seeing Kamper do what he did. They were now in ready stances, with weapons out.

“You wouldn’t understand the answer if I said it.” Kamper replied.

“What do you want?” Tsunade asked, starting to grasp how uncertainly immense Kamper’s potential power and risk was.

“Nothing. As I have said, I just got here. So, not trying to kill me would be most kind of you.” Kamper replied as calm as any of his other answers.

“You want nothing? No power, no money, no status…?” Tsunade asked.

“I find no value in such things. Not that there is anything in those options that you could give that would be enough to impress me. I suppose that a good standing relationship with you will be enough, if you must have something…” Kamper replied, the last part a little less formally.

“I… I don’t know what to… say…” Tsunade stated.
12231.title: They go talk elsewhere.

122312.content:
After a little deliberation, they escorted him out of the building and down a street. It was clear at this point that they couldn’t contain him in any way. Tsunade complimented him on his patience then asked where he would like to go. She offered a meal, but he just asked to be taken to the largest open space they had. They escorted him to a very large training field. A few more were following at this point. Mainly curious people and a few other high ranking ninja. A few of which were a white haired man that looked like a fool, but was about as powerful as Tsunade was. Kamper didn’t take much time to relate to them, yet. He needed to establish himself first, and figure out a few things.

“Well, we are here, now what?” Tsunade asked after she presented the field to Kamper.

“Stay there, and don’t move.” Kamper instructed. Most were put off that he was ordering them around, but did as commanded.

“Hmm… That is strange….” Kamper almost whispered as he walked a little bit into the field then tried to open up other portals. A few being the one to Canas, Donguy, and his realm to name a few. He was unsuccessful. He turned off his training equipment and tried again… nothing. It wasn’t a lack of power, he was just too far out of tune with those worlds and realms. Must be a whole other reality. Kamper then had an idea. He put out his hand and attempted to open a summoning portal. He had felt a summoning contract with a few of the ninja that he had come in contact with. He was delighted to learn that it worked. A short time later there was an explosion and a whoosh of wings, clearing the smoke away to give sight to an enormous black dragon that he knew all too well.

“This… this place smells wrong…” Said Nodrag as he sniffed and searched for the only person that the dragons had gave a summoning contract to, Kamper/Death. He looked at an on guard group of people before resting his eyes on Kamper. “There you are, young one!”

“Yes, Master Nodrag, it is good to see you again.” Kamper said with a smile, bowing respectfully.

“It has been some time since we last spoke, over 100 years by my count. We were beginning to think that something had happened to you.” Nodrag said in his usual very deep voice.

“It would be quicker to just show you.” Kamper replied to which he came over and touched the large dragon’s temple, inserting his experiences over the last 150 years. Nodrag shuddered with the information overflow. But as Kamper returned to a more speaking distance, Nodrag recovered and was able to respond.

“I see, that complicates things. I am afraid that you will have to do your own research in the matter of returning. Let me know what you find and I will attempt to send word to the friends you still have, that are alive.” Nodrag.

“Is there a way that I can come back with you?” Kamper asked, slightly hoping to do so.

“I’m afraid not, Young One. The art of summoning in the matter necessary for bringing me here only works because this… reality… has the system to accommodate for summoning. However, since magic was used to send you there, you must find the answer through magic to send you back.” Nodrag informed, causing Kamper to sigh slightly but not lose composure.

“Very well, understood Master.” Kamper responded respectfully.

“I am sorry young one. For what it is worth, you may call on me or any of my children at any time. I would expect that Duke would be wanting some time to catch up with you as well.” Nodrag responded, more sympathetically that usual.

“Thank you, Master. I will definitely take you up on that.” Kamper said with a bow. Then, with an explosion of smoke, he was gone. Kamper simply stood there for a little bit. He was content in waiting for the ninja to make contact, but he did instruct them to stay there and, to their credit, they had obeyed. So he walked over to them.

“W-what was that?!” Tsunade asked.

“A dragon, a friend from my home realm. He informed me that I am unable to be sent back and I can’t go with him to return. So I guess I am stuck here.” Kamper informed.

“A…A D-dragon?!” Asked an older person that didn’t look overly powerful. Kamper assumed that she was an elder of some kind.

“Well, Tsunade and I can summon our summoning animals. Giant toads and slugs are available, so why not Giant dragons…” Said the man with long white hair.

“Good point.” Tsunade stated then turned back to Kamper. “What is your plan then?”

“With permission, I would like 2 things.” Kamper stated, to which they started listening more intensely. “First is admittance into the village as a member. Second is to have a property where I can create and operate a forge.”

“We already have many fine blacksmith shops.” Said an older man, probably another elder.

“Very well, I will make my specialized weapons and armor elsewhere, but a place of residence would be much appreciated.” Kamper returned.

“We will need time to speak of this with our counsel and other leaders, will you come with us and wait?” Tsunade asked.

“As you wish…” Kamper stated and was escorted on to a large, primarily red building.
122312.title: Speaking with Nodrag.

choices: Master Jiraiya wants to test Kamper.
1223121.content:
“We can’t afford not to. If he goes to another village…” Jiraiya said as the council met and deliberated.

“But he is not of this village, how can we make him part of it, just like that?” asked one of the elders.

Unknown to them, Kamper could hear all that was going on. They had him in an adjacent room so they could tell him their decision right away. However, a single closed door was not much of a deterrent when it came to listening in, not for him at least.

“I don’t remember him asking that he should be a leaf village ninja or anything like that. I seemed to recall him asking for residence inside the village and membership. We can gift him residence and have him as a long standing guest until we get to know him. Although not a man of many words, he seems sensible enough.” Another white haired man named Kakashi Hatake answered.

“But he could just as easily destroy the village, judging on the crater he left just coming here!” Cried one of the elders.

“All the more reason to keep him close. If he is indeed a threat to deal with, then why send him away to hide? And if he is a potential ally, then why turn away such powerful help. Even if for some unlikely event, he is weak, he had that dragon to summon. You can’t say that it would be a bad thing to have at least a dragon on our side…” Tsunade replied, with many nodding to her reasoning in agreement.

“What of his claim to make weapons elsewhere?” One of the Elders put forth.

“Why don’t we give him a large lot in the village to work out of, that doubles as his residence. That way he has to choose what is more important to him, his forge or his home and build accordingly.” Jiraiya suggested.

“Would he make weapons for the village, or against it?” Asked another man by the name of Donzo.

“We could always ASK HIM that question.” Tsunade sarcastically suggested.

“Fine then, if we are in agreement of him staying in the leaf with the property he requested, we can tell him now.” Jiraiya said and the others, some reluctantly nodded. Obviously there would be more talk later, as some of them liked to talk a lot about their opinions on the matter. A few ninja went out and retrieved him from his position, escorting him in the room. He stood at the spot instructed and waited as they looked at him. It was unclear if they just wanted to make him sweat or if they were just good at taking their time.

“Kamper… do you have a last name?” Asked Tsunade.

“No.” Kamper replied simply.

“Very well, Kamper, we have agreed to gift you with an empty plot of land inside the village. You will be afforded to do as you wish in that plot, wither it be building a house or a forge, it is up to you. In addition, you will be granted a status as a long standing guest in the leaf. We simply need more time to see if you are compatible enough to be a leaf village member. As such, you are free to walk around, train as you like, and must obey our laws as a member of the villages so we can see how you would do in that roll.” Lady Tsunade said. If Kamper was going to agree to this, then he would need to change to an attitude that gave the societal respect of their leadership.

“I accept, Lady Tsunade.” Kamper said with a bow.

“Ok, before we escort you to your land, we would like to know something.” And elder started to which Kamper looked her way. His concentrated gaze made her stumble a little and flinch, but she caught herself and continued, “You said that you would be making weapons and armor, what did you mean by that?”

“I am capable and have a knack for creating specialty items and high grade weapons. The higher end things are made for clients, and being that I am in the Leaf Village, then the clients would most likely be for the Leaf Village. For the other things, I make for my own amusement and to help others, mostly for no charge.” Kamper responded.

“So, just to be clear, you would NOT be making weapons for our enemies?” Lady Tsunade asked for them.

“Incorrect.” Kamper stated, to which they started getting nervous and Kamper thought it best to establish his meaning before their imaginations could run wild. “For all lower grade items I make for local people, so unless you make a habit out of letting your ‘enemies’ stay in your village, then that won’t be a problem. But for high end things, if someone were to come into the village, with or without your knowledge, convince me to make something for them, then turn out to be an enemy. In such a case, I would’ve supplied my goods to an enemy. However, it is not my place to filter who comes and goes in the village. That being said, as long as a situation like that doesn’t come to pass, I will not be supplying your enemies, and I certainly won’t be seeking out your enemies to sell to them.”

“Ok, that makes more sense.” Master Jiraiya stated.

“Very well, we will have someone escort you to the plot we have set aside for you.” Said an elder.

“Don’t bother…” Master Jiraiya said, to which they all looked at him. “I’ll take him, better to get to know the new kid on the block anyway…”
1223121.title: They accept his requests.

12231211.content:
“So, I know this is a little unorthodox, but I was wondering if you could do me a favor?” Jiraiya asked as he walked with Kamper through the town.

“As long as I eventually get to my new residence, then I will do what I can.” Kamper answered without really asking what it was this strange white haired man wanted.

“Excellent!!!” He remarked as he changed directions and went to the same training area he had summoned Nodrag in. It was apparent that others new what he was going to do, as there was a few watching, more noticeable a young blonde haired boy that Kamper could feel was not what he appeared to be. “I just want to test you a little bit, just to see if it would be right to request a mission or two out of you, if that is ok with you?”

“As you wish.” Kamper said simply then straightened and got into a simple stance, facing Jiraiya.

“Do you know how ninja spar?” Jiraiya asked.

“Yes.” Kamper stated. It was a moot point. Every sparing match where he grew up was a potentially fatal match. Not that he could die easily anyway.

With that said, Jiraiya backed up and started the match by throwing some small knife like weapons known as Kunai at Kamper, who barely moved to dodge them. It made it look like Jiraiya had missed. Kamper didn’t have to do much as he deflected or dodged pretty much anything thrown at him, all without moving more than 3 feet. At one point, Jiraiya used a high grade wind attack. Kamper just used his energy to spin the wind in the opposite direction, cancelling his move out. Through all that, Kamper had yet to take the offense. He seemed content just letting his opponent wear himself out. Finally, Jiraiya got serious and summoned a giant toad that was slightly smaller than Nodrag.

“What is this, Jiraiya. Calling me out here for this small one?” The toad complained.

“Just attack and see how helpless he is.” Jiraiya challenged. The toad did so with his great sword. Kamper could’ve dodged easily. Such a large weapon was not hard to see coming. But he chose to catch the incoming blade instead, then proceeded to hold it there, not letting the toad retrieve his sword from his grasp.

“This can’t be possible!” The toad said as he tried to squash Kamper flat.

Kamper replied by putting up his hand and using wind to blast him back a considerable distance, letting go of the sword as well. Trees and ground were thrown about as the behemoth of a toad skidded to a halt then came back over. They definitely didn’t want to lose, so they continued. Each time, Kamper would send them flying without any noticeable effort. When it came for a large fire attack and what they said were ‘wind bullets’ Kamper just absorbed them… in a matter of speaking. When both of his opponents were tired out, they stopped the fight and the toad went elsewhere with a white puff of smoke.

“That…” started Jiraiya as he caught his breath, further marveling that Kamper wasn’t. “… that was crazy. For you to just stand there and take all that, my best shots, and not feel a thing. I believe that you are one good friend to have.”

“Your praise is appreciated.” Kamper replied with a slight bow.

“I suppose you want to get to the area you’ll be staying then.” Jiraiya stated. He waited for a response, but learned quickly that Kamper wasn’t an overly large talker. So he led Kamper through the small crowd of surprised people and through the village, to a plot of land that was empty, save for a few scrap pieces of garbage lying around. “Well, this is it.”

“It is perfect, thank you.” Kamper replied then walked toward the center and started mapping out what he wanted and where. It was a slightly larger plot of land than a normal house, just big enough for a forge, if he wanted it. With a plan in motion, he went to work. The ninja had a habit on spying on people. So, even though Jiraiya had officially walked away, others were watching Kamper as he worked.

122312112.content:
Kamper worked and worked for weeks, without stopping. However, most only saw that as the only irregularity. The fact that he barely ate or slept was the only VISIBLE thing that caught the ninjas’ eye. The young blonde kid would sneak around and spy on him as well, of course Kamper knew who was there and why. To the untrained eye, he was just steadily working. But if someone actually knew what he was doing, they would’ve been amazed.

With each board he put down, ever stone he put in place, and every piece of steel he forged for the construction; all of it was infused with charms of every type of energy he knew. The three types being; magical, physical, and spiritual energy. When he appeared to be singing in a soothingly deep voice, he was actually casting spells and charms on things. Little by little his place was built. Each piece was so high quality that even he would have a hard time destroying it. Such a thing was needed, as any serious forging on an inferior surface would not be a good thing, or useful for that matter. If every time he put his hammer down it broke the anvil, then what use was it? Even the windows could handle an unbelievable amount of punishment.

Outside the forge looked inconspicuous to the rest of the village. He didn’t need people to start asking questions or for enemies of the village to target his building. However, it was self-cleaning and in addition to its strength, it also had panels on it that doubled as energy stores from the sun. This energy he could use for many things, but he soon learned that it was also called, ‘electricity’. Either way, the stores he had could light up the whole village for a year, when full. On the inside he had all the tools he needed to create any item he needed/wanted. From silk crafting items to a heavy forge, he was all set. He also put in a vault of sorts that held any and all completed works for display. People could look at them, but a barrier was around the room. No one could touch anything without his say so. Finally there was a small area connected to the vault for sleep. A simple bed was all that was there. In the fault he made a spot for his armor and weapons. He didn’t need them on at the moment. He doubted that he would need them at all. So he put them on a display so others could see, but not touch. If he ever needed them, he merely needed. To summon them like before anyway. So he dressed in a simple black get up. Some dragon scale black pants and boots with a sleeveless shirt to match, made of the same thing. With that all done, he got to work experimenting with things of this ‘realm’ he found himself in. He exposed himself to a few new things, but most of it was the same as the earth he left.

CRASH!!! Came a noise one morning as someone stumbled in Kamper’s shop. He looked at a sprawled out kid. The main door for the shop’s use was in the vault room but also visible to the forge and finishing area, so no matter where he was inside, he could address any who entered.

“Uh… Sorry to intrude!!!” yelled a kid before Kamper could say anything. It was the same blonde haired kid that was spying on him. But as soon as he looked up at Kamper’s selection of items, he was memorized. There wasn’t a lot, yet. But each piece was without compare, especially his released form’s armor and weapons.

“What can I help you with?” Kamper asked as he walked over to the Vault to address him. It was a common question to ask in shops, Kamper found.

“I… uh… did you make all these?” The kid asked.

“Yes.” Kamper responded.

“They must be crazy expensive!” The kid stated, apparently having an eye for weapons… then again, most ninja did. Ninja tools were always a source of knowledge for a ninja.

“They are free.” Kamper replied.

“Free?” He asked.

“Yes, if you can take them, you can have them.” Kamper replied then watched as the kid browsed his selection. He was hesitant but then tried touching a Katana. When his skin made contact, flames shot out from it and sent him flying. He rebounded quite quickly and took a defensive stance.

“What was that!?” He exclaimed. “I thought you said I could have one!?”

“I never said that. I said, ‘if you can take them, you can have them’. My weapons are made and choose their own master. If any besides their master tries to use them… they retaliate, as you have experienced. In a way, they have a mind of their own. So, if it chooses a master, I have no right to keep the two from being with each other. Thus the free price. If you find a weapon that chooses you, then you can have it, free of charge. But don’t assume that any of them will go with you just because you want them to.” Kamper explained as the kid looked at the sword, just stopping its flame and was back the way it was before he tried to touch it.

“What is this one?” He asked, pointing to a hammer.

“First, before I answer too many questions, what is your name?” Kamper asked.

“Naruto…”

(Author’s note: I may take from other sources to make it easier to understand. Such as, the hammer would be ‘Thor’s Hammer’. I am not trying to bash or copy too much, it is just to make the understanding better. If you write, you may do the same. )

“Well, Naruto, that is ‘Thor’s Hammer’. I don’t really think it is your cup of tea. I think, now that I’ve me you formally, you would find this useful.” Kamper said as he pointed to, what looked like, a normal Leaf ninja headband. He looked at it then went to touch it. Instead of attacking him, it lunged forward and pretty much melted into his head, then came out, forcing his other one off.

“WHAT!...” He started, catching his falling headband and pulling at his new one. “What is this!!!”

“Well, it appears that you don’t have a connection to a particular type of weapon. Sure you use and don’t use certain weapons, but you don’t consider one YOU. So, this headband will disappear and reappear when you wish it, but otherwise be an indestructible part of you. NO ONE will ever be able to take it or damage it for that matter. Also, since it is bonded with you, you don’t have to tie it on or worry about losing it, in battle or otherwise. It also gives you the ability to fortify and strengthen your mind as you see fit. Sure it will require you to train. But you will be a supreme power over your own mind, even more so than if someone were to do a Genjutsu or try to otherwise enter your mind.” Kamper revealed. Kamper knew that this boy was more of a physical fighter with loads of potential, but there was some nasty non-physical ways to fight. This object helped with that. Sure not to a Titan level, but far superior to anything Kamper had witnessed in this world.

“You mean… I don’t have to worry about Genjustu???” He asked excitedly.

“I didn’t say that.” Kamper responded which made Naruto’s expression drop. “However, with your new headband, it will help you train in that regard and guide you. Where an experienced ninja might have to train for decades to learn how to guard their mind, you will be able to do it in days, if you work hard on it. Afterwards, you will find that not many Genjutsu will work at all on you… and… that spirit inside you will be less likely to take over.”

“What?!? How did you know about that!!!” Naruto asked.

“We all have our abilities and special talents.” Kamper answered simply.

“You mean the nine-tails will be further sealed?” He asked.

“If that is your wish. I will repeat. YOU will be in control of your mind. So, if you wish him to take over than he will. If you wish him to not interfere, he will not have a choice in the matter.” Kamper responded, making Naruto thankful and confused. “Go on now. I am sure you can figure your new toy out. I will be here if you have further questions.”

“Ok… wait, how do I train with this?” Naruto asked.

“How do you train your mind?” Kamper asked as an answer.

“By meditating, of course.” Naruto responded then Kamper turned to continue his work. “… got it, ok, see you later and… Thanks a lot!”

With that, Naruto bounded out of Kamper’s forge. Kamper dwelled on the strange but uplifting boy for a while. Of all the people he had met so far, HE was the most uplifting. He had an… aura about him. Despite his extra passenger and the potential chaos of the beast within, he was still happy and uplifted everyone around him. Kamper decided that he would allow him to grow as he should, but help him when he could. With that decided, he went back to work.

155321.content:
As his skin and other parts of him cracked and went back to normal there were black clouds starting to form around him. He didn't have much control over that. He was at full power until he was fully free, at which point he could seal a high majority of his power. He waited, knowing full well that the darkening sky, the intense gravity, and the atmospheric effects of his power would attract people around him. Like he predicted, when he was all done and the last of the Sinc left his body, there was an explosion of power that shot up into the sky like a beam of black energy that only served to make mini earth quakes and make the sky even blacker than it already was. However, he quickly moved to remedy this. After the initial energy spike; he dematerialized his swords, transformed into is 'Kamper' form, and started otherwise sealing his power. In the course of a few minutes he was all sealed and exhausted. But even him being completely sealed and exhausted was still stronger than normal humans. So, with his training equipment on and his power more or less sealed, he started walking.

It was luck on his part that his entrance and awakening was not foreseen by whatever beings governing this world. Because by the time he could sense a gaze from a few more powerful individuals, he was long gone. His sealed form was good enough to fool even the Titans from where he was from, there was no way that anyone around here would be able to guess that he had such power. He walked for a while, until he found himself in a city of some kind. For the first time he was grateful of simplicity. From what he could tell, there was nothing that was new to hurt him. This... Realm... was just like his. No abnormal energy or material. In fact, his Realm was probably more diverse than this one.

"Halt!" Said a guard. Kamper looked him over quickly. Just like most of the 'warriors' around here, he wasn't in full armor, or metal armor. He had a large shield on his left arm, a short sword strapped to his waste, and a spear gracing his right arm. One that was now pointing at his head. Other than that though, he had a helmet, a cape of some kind, sandals, and piece that was little better than a loin cloth. Kamper stopped to be addressed by this 'guard'. "What do you want here?"

"Shelter, sir." Kamper said with a bow. Once again, that simple act seemed to melt the hostility of those around him. An ego based pride was easily controlled.

"Very well, watch your step. Cause any trouble and I'll run you through!" He barked, then lowered his spear and let him pass.

Kamper walked around, getting strange looks from people every once in a while. It was probably the way he dressed. Most people were not wearing as much coverings as he was, and his was slightly different then the social norm. So, before he did too much else, he dematerialized his own armor and put on a black sleeveless type of shirt with his pair of dragon lining pants and boots, with a black cloak that he saw being sold at a few places. Finishing the ensemble was his Death Sword on his back and his training gloves on. He had too be careful though, while doing magic or anything out of the ordinary. The larger powers he felt were constantly looking in on people, and him by default.

"What can I do you for?" Asked a merchant.

"Yes, I am new around Greece in general. Who are the strongest warriors?" He asked, which almost immediately caused the man and all those around him to laugh.

"That!... That is the first time I have EVER heard that question!" He laughed, but Kamper was patient and waited for the man to finish. Apparently the question was obvious. "You must be from anther world to not know the answer to that. The Spartans are known to everyone! No one questions who the best is. Even people from across the see and in the heavens know that one. People say that they are decedents of Hercules himself!"

"My thanks." Kamper responded then left before he caught any more attention. But the others were still laughing at him as he walked away. It must be extremely obvious that these 'Spartans' were the top of the warrior ladder around here, for them to just burst out laughing and not go into a game of 20 questions over him not knowing about them. Instead of asking another person, he gleaned the answer or where Sparta was from people around him, then headed there.

1553211.content:
While this new world was not without its hazards, the walk from where he was to Sparta was surprisingly eventless. There was the odd bandit and whatnot, but Kamper silently dealt with them easily. As he neared Sparta though, the bandits got progressively more skilled. In a way it made sense. For a bandit to be successful in this part of the country, they would have to be able to kill a Spartan, and everything that Kamper had heard was that Spartans were no ones to be taken lightly, even in single combat against a group. Eventually Kamper made it to Sparta and was scouting a bit.

"Nothing for sale for you here." said a blacksmith as Kamper approached.

"I do not wish for product, only information." Kamper replied with a bow. But he only received a backhanded blow from the man as his response. While he could've easily avoided or prevented such a low level blow, he did not wish to cause trouble.

"I SAID... nothing for sale for you here!" He almost growled out, then returned to his work. For people who had only achieved iron working skills, they had a very high opinion of themselves. Kamper had no choice but to pick himself up and go on his way.

That attitude toward him as a non-Spartan stranger was normal. It seamed that the only people that weren't full blooded Spartans were a very select few of free men that were proving useful and a few slaves. But the high majority of people were fully battle trained to the Spartan standard. Even the elderly looked like they'd be a match for a normal person in the other militaries that Kamper had seen, like the guard he had first saw. Eventually Kamper only saw one course open to him. He had to talk with an authority in the city. Although other parts of the society was well guarded, meeting with its people was not one of them. Most could go anywhere as long as they didn't mind a sword in the gut if they found themselves in the wrong place. So Kamper wandered to what looked like a training area.

In the training area he found a group of Spartans fighting. But this level was borderline crazy. There was 5 men beating the crap out of the one in the middle, while that man was fighting almost successfully back. However, the guards and teachers around were not stopping the fight, more encouraging it. Kamper found this odd, but tolerable. If this was one of the ways they trained then that was something that he understood. He, after all, had a pretty crazy training sessions as well. So he leaned against one of the entrance pillars and watched them.

"Stroking your pride with what a true warrior is capable?" Asked a feminine voice from behind him. Kamper of course knew that she was coming. He turned to properly address her. She was a comparatively beautiful women that was obviously high up in their society. One thing that was easy to guess in this new world was the social order of people. Their upkeep and status all gave clues to those that could perceive them. This women looked close to a queen in upkeep, but too young.

"They are very impressive My Lady..." Kamper said as he bowed to one knee. This seamed to please the young woman, but not impress her. She didn't look more than 17 years old, but also looked very put together and capable, as all Spartans did.

"Of course they do. They are my father's personal guard." She stated with a certain amount of pride.

"That makes you the King's daughter?" Kamper asked in an embellished tone that got her to blush a little.

"Figure that one out yourself?" She teased. She wasn't snobby or anything like that. It seamed like she was just judging him as someone that wasn't a Spartan. It was a sentiment that seemed to be a constant trend among them.

"Indeed." Kamper answered in a respectful tone, as if he was accepting his rank in life, to her eyes at least.

"What are you doing here?" She asked.

"I am new to Greece. I was hoping to find a place to settle and perhaps be useful. Someone said that Sparta was the place with the best warriors so I decided that the place I want to settle would be around Sparta, if that is possible." Kamper explained.

"That is not for you or me to decide." she stated mater of factly.

"May I ask whom I must talk to then?" Kamper asked respectfully, still bowing in respect.

"Alexa, what is this?" Asked a very impressive looking man. He was obviously the King and both his mannerism, presence, and statue was that of someone that led the greatest warriors in the world. Kamper himself looked no more than 20 years old, when in actuality he had lived for more than 200 years with 1000 years of training. So looks weren't everything. However, for what this King was looking for, it looked like his daughter was introducing a very young man.

"Found him watching some of your guard practicing. Says he wants to live in or near Sparta, so I brought him to you." She responded. Her persona completely changed when talking to him. It was somewhere between bashful and proud of him.

"You did good. Now leave us." He stated to her in a gentler tone. When she had left he turned his attention to Kamper. So, you want to live in Sparta?"

"Very much so, yes." Kamper responded with a bow.

"I don't think you understand what that request is. We care not that you are useful or your desire. If we gave permission to everyone that wanted to join our population, then we would have a weak nation. You must prove you are worthy of this request." The King said.

"How may I do that?" Kamper asked, still bowed to him.

Before he could say more there was an impact on the side of his head. It came from a boot of the King, driving him to the ground. Again, Kamper could've avoided it but he didn't wish to make a seen that could be gawked at. He was also keeping a low key presence in the gaze of whatever powers that were currently looking down on him from above. Either way, more kicks and blows followed, but he got up each time and resumed the bowed position to one knee. Some of the times the King would have others do the blows, and at times it resounded with sickening impact that even got them to cringe. But regardless how much blood was flowing, Kamper still got up and got back into a one knee bowed position. This continued until the Spartans administering this.... test... were actually out of breath. At this point the King had them stop and address the battered Kamper as he still kneeled.

"Not many could take that kind of beating. Why do you not fight back?" He asked.

"Sometimes, more is said without retaliating." Kamper responded.

"True enough..." He said with some thought.

155321112.content:
"I can't allow for such a weak man to remain in Sparta. You must leave. However, I can have you taken to a mountain side that isn't owned by anyone. You may live there or find somewhere else in Greece to live. That will be the closest you will get to living in Sparta." The King said after some thought.

"Yes, I understand." Kamper said, then was taken away rather forcefully. The Spartan Guards pushed, shoved, and kicked him out of the land by a large mountain range, like the King of Sparta had said. Some watched, but most laughed at this.

Eventually he was left alone, after the Spartans escorting him got a few last blows in for good measure and a warning not to return to Sparta or to bother their King anymore. With that Kamper got up and made his way through the Mountains. He searched until he found the biggest one. It was obvious that this realm didn't have any Dwarves or such people that made their cities in the mountains or beneath the earth. So Kamper started working on the mountain side. Once again, Kamper couldn't demonstrate too much ability, as the powerful beings he was feeling were looking at him from time to time. So he staggered his working so not to be noticed. The first thing he did was make an entrance in the side of the mountain with HUGE double doors made of Granite and reinforced with thick steel beams. He would need to upgrade eventually, but for a time that had only just mastered bronze working, they would suffice. He also put enchantments on them, just in case. Basically he made the doors strong enough to keep out or welcome even Charity from home at her full size of 500 feet tall.

After that he started work on the inside. He transformed the inside of the mountain into a castle of a fortress. It was a very elaborate Castle, but hidden in the mountain, but also scaled the same as the doors were. He made a master forge and craftsman shop under the castle where he could work on more powerful weapons without being spied on by the powers he was feeling. He didn't know what he would encounter, but keeping up his talent for making armor and weapons of the highest caliber was definitely a plus. Finally he put on the finishing touches. The entire place was overlaid with 10 feet of solid gold, and that was overlaid with a layer of diamond. He didn't need people damaging the gold floor or other surfaces, especially if he invited a dragon or something like that in there. Finally he put a few natural sources of light. He had to be careful because the nature of this place was to be strong and hidden enough to repel anything, sight or force. So he made a sort of entryway at the top where light was filtered in and sent down, as well as making a place for others to wet their curiosity.

When he was confident he had created a well enough home, he went to the throne room and started summoning everyone he had a summoning contract with. One by one he would talk with them then tell them his situation. They would wish him luck and offer to spread the word that you were ok but out of touch for a while at least. They all offered to help if ever he needed it. The last one to contact was Duke, a Dragon friend that he had saved when he was just a little hatchling. Now he was rather large and intimidating to most, not to Kamper though.

"Here I thought you were living in poverty or hiding out." Duke responded as he walked around the Castle with Kamper. Like most dragons, he had a thing for treasure. So the gold floor, ceiling, walls had appealed to him greatly.

"This world is a pain, but there is a few advantages. These things were really easy to find. Plus there are no Dwarves to worry about so I got to build this mountain castle without worry." Kamper replied.

"That has to be a good addition. No Scepters either, that has to be nice. Oh, before I forget..." Duke said then began hacking a great deal. After a few tries, out flew a familiar Bald Eagle from his jaws. It was Pride, Kamper's old messenger bird, given to him by the dragons and as immortal as Kamper was. "Sorry about that. When we heard you were summoning us we had to get you something to remember us by. Pride has been ecstatic ever since you disappeared from your spot in Shadow Valley."

Pride shook off the dragon drool then flew over to Kamper, perching on his shoulder very... prideful that he was now serving his master again.

"Thanks." Kamper said as he stroked Pride a few times.

"So, how long are you going to be stuck here?" Duke asked. It was a common question for those that he was meeting. Duke, despite his size, was the nearest to Kamper's age and one of his oldest friends.

"I don't know. I would assume until I can first replicate the spell used to send me here, that would probably spit me out into another realm. Then I would need to master it, then I will be able to come back at will. It may take a considerable amount of time." Kamper answered as he sent Pride off to explore the Castle. He would have to make a way for him to get out without letting anyone else in.

"Not easy being you, is it?" Duke asked with a sympathy glance then went to change the subject. "So, how are the people of this world?"

"Same as ours, just a bit more primitive. There are some higher beings, but I have yet to communicate with them. The other humans have their own societies and whatnot. All impressive in their own way. But no diversity in species. Just humans, no Elves or Dwarves... or Dragons for that matter. I might find the rare one, but no large nests as best as I can tell." Kamper reported.

"Well, if you ever need any of our help, you know we will do so." He said as you both made it back to the throne room. "Take care of yourself Buddy."

"You too." Kamper replied back.

Duke nodded then was sent back to his realm.
