1553211122.content:
Kamper was tempted to just stay in his new home. The large doors and the almost shrine like entrance were the only places on the outside that signified that he was there. In the decade since he started his work, people and... other beings had scouted out the two new landmarks, but other than that, he had remained excluded from the outside world's problems. He even spent a bit of time filling his armory with VERY advanced weapons and armor. But he could only stay in his very large castle so long. So, with that done, he decided to go out into the world. He exited and locked his castle. From the markings on the door, it looked like some very strong beings had tried to get in. They had to be in order to even scratch the door through the barriers he set up. He could feel a presence observe him exit his castle then keep their gaze as he moved away. He headed out of the mountain pass that his castle doors fed into. He saw Pride fly out of the "window". The "window" was just a shift in perception that only Pride could access.

He didn't need to worry about Pride. He had already linked him to his energy and life, making Pride have a very small portion of Death/Kamper's power and abilities. Still didn't have a sapient mind, but had a version of it and more than capable of defending himself and many others if needed, even against something as deadly as a dragon... again, if necessary.

Kamper moved around the country, but didn't enter Sparta. He would obey the order of the Spartan King, as the Spartans were the only race, currently, that he favored. He kept going, observing quite a bit. He would come across the random bandit raid, or quarrel. He didn't interfere, but every once in a while he sensed one of the more powerful beings above interfere, a few still watching him closely. He went into cities and kept as low profile as possible. But this mode of investigation could only last for so long.

"Get away...!" Croaked a very weak voice.

Kamper was currently searching an area in which he had felt a different form of energy. Unlike the lighter version he had felt from above, this was dark and almost the opposite feel. As if he had moved into some other power's territory. He felt the hard presence of a battle and went to it. There he found a strange sight.

There were burnt craters and impact marks everywhere and in the middle of one of them there was a very large woman. She must've been about 50 feet tall and glowing with gold looking armor on. She also had a bow and arrow with her, out of her hands now with a spent quiver on her back. She was on the ground and being stalked by a dark individual that looked like a demon. He had red eyes and the horns of a bull with a spaded tail, almost breathing fire. He was a few heads (their heads) taller than her and obviously going in for the kill. Kamper was just going to leave things where they lay, but a few things made him reconsider. One was that the light one looked good, and the other one just felt evil. Another reason was that he couldn't feel the gaze of the higher beings he was avoiding at the moment.

"I will take pride in skinning you!" Snarled the demon, or whatever he was as he moved forward, still stalking the woman who was barely able to move back by crawling backwards. She was weak now and they both knew it.

"Please leave." came a response as Kamper was noticed by both of them. He had sped over to a small rising of earth to the side of them.

"What are you doing? Run away, mortal!" The woman exclaimed weakly. She was barely able to stay awake, much less escape. But she used some of her remaining strength to warn Kamper. That was earning her even more points.

"He obviously wants to bow to me, and see me skin a so called 'god'." The Demon blared with a wicked smile as he looked back over to her and pulled out a large knife. She was in no position to stop him and he approached her with the blade but then was thrown back as an invisible impact smacked into his head and flung him into a nearby mountain wall. "What was that?"

"I asked you to leave." Kamper repeated as he glared at him. "I am not used to repeating myself to likes of you."

"You did that! Impossible!" He blared as he got up and rushed forward. "One of the other god's must be here! Show yourself!"

"Quick, run!" The woman said again to Kamper, thinking the Demon was distracted. She was right to worry about a normal human's safety. Even if she was being rescued, a fight between another of her kind and this Demon would be dangerous for a lone human. She obviously didn't think Kamper was the cause of the attack either.

"It appears that I must be more clear." Kamper said. His small voice seamed to magically reach each one of them as if he was their size and talking right in front of them. They both looked at him. He lifted an arm and the Demon was lifted off his feet, being restrained by an invisible power, now obviously of Kamper's doing. The Demon tried to move but was unable to move even an inch in a way that Kamper wouldn't allow. Kamper floated to meet him face to face, within Kamper's arm reach. "This is the third time I will ask, there will not be a fourth. PLEASE LEAVE!"

With that he lifted an arm and used a finger in a flicking motion to the large Demon's head which caused him to go flying into the distance and out of a normal sight line. Kamper could feel him land a few miles in the distance, then floated over to the large woman that now laid motionless on the ground, unconscious.

"Why must this always happen?" Kamper asked himself as he tried to figure out what to do.

On the one hand he could get her to his Castle. The powers he was avoiding wouldn't be able to see him teleport her there with him and she looked like she needed some medical attention.

On the other hand, she looked to be one of these 'gods' that were spying on him and seemed to be capable of defending herself. Not to mention that the other 'gods' would be able to see past the barrier that the Demon had made and send help, if they hadn't done so already. Also, as a Titan in his world, his job was to 'test' any so called 'gods' and kill them if they stepped out of line. This wasn't his world, so he had no desire to impact this one by his rules, but there it was...

What should he do?
1553211122.title: Kamper goes out to explore.

choices: She wants her stuff and maybe some answers after that.
15532111221.content:
Kamper didn't really have much to do other than explore, and he didn't want to start out a relationship with these 'gods' in a bad light. So, before anyone knew anything different he picked up her, her weapons, and what was left of her tattered battle attire, then teleported them all to his castle. He put her in a room that was accustomed to her size, filled it with things that she would look for right away; stuff like food, water, a white and gold silk robe. Then he went out to repair her armor and weapons. They were different and as such it took him a while to learn about them and whatnot, but they were nowhere near the quality that he was used to working with. So once he figured them out, they were easy to repair. She only started to wake as he placed her newly repaired bow and quiver full of new arrows on a rack beside her armor in the armory. He could feel her moving around and wonder at the castle. He didn't know what she was accustomed to, but waking in a strange new place after being attacked, all made of gold, was enough to make anyone curious. So Kamper waited in the relaxation area that was directly outside this area of personal rooms.

"Where am I?" She asked as she came out of her room, wearing the robe Kamper had provided and... glowing a little. Kamper didn't notice this when he put the healing spell on her. It must have something to do with how or where she gets her power. Her question was more to herself then anyone, as she looked around curiously.

"You are in my home." Kamper responded, his low voice echoing through the halls of the room. After all, it was made for both 1 inch people and 500 foot people, so it was quite vast. She searched for the owner of the voice until she found him and approached.

"And who are you?" She asked, apparently not ready to let her guard down, despite being unarmed at the moment.

"My name is Kamper. I believe you and your kind have been watching me for some time." Kamper revealed.

"You mean you are the mortal that built his house behind those doors he... you made? and the shrine?" She asked.

"Indeed I am." Kamper responded.

"And this is the place inside that mountain and behind those doors?" She asked, gesturing to the room.

"Some of it, yes." Kamper responded. "Now, a question I have for you. Who and what was that demon that was attacking you earlier?"

"You mean you don't know?" She asked, almost astounded then a thought popped into her head. "Do you even know who I am?"

"No, I do not." He revealed, this shocked her even more. It took a few minutes for her to collect herself.

"I am goddess Artemis." She revealed, her arm sweeping as if her name would reveal something to Kamper of great value. She was a little confused by his lack of awe at her presence. She then continued, "The 'demon' as you called it was a high ranking titan soldier. Probably an assassin of some kind, sent to kill me."

"Titans, gods, and goddesses. This place just gets better and better. I have to assume that Titans are not the same as they are from where I am from?" Kamper asked.

"What are they like where you come from?" She asked.

"They maintain order and make sure that normal humans and whatnot are not forced to do a 'god's' bidding by holding a 'divine' power over them. If their thirst for worship and power is too much, the Titan around... deals with them." Kamper answered.

"So, they are not at war with each other, the gods and titans from where you are from?" She asked confused.

"No, the Titans only number in the single digits, but they far outmatch the 'gods'." Kamper answered.
15532111221.title: He takes her back to his Castle.

choices: Kamper finds more in need of help.
155321112212.content:
"While all of this is very enlightening, what have you done with by belongings?" Artemis asked, looking to be a bit more bold now.

"This way." Kamper waved as he started to walk down the enormous halls to the armory.

With his comparatively smaller size, it took some time and Artemis constantly had to slow down or take shorter strides. But that wasn't as hard as it seemed, especially since she was looking around the gold castle Kamper had made. Every once in a while she would see a statue of some kind. Kamper had created some intricate sculptures of his friends and family, but made out of different precious stones and metals. They looked accurate, but not life like. Kind of like an overly embellished picture of someone.

"You built all of this?" Artemis asked. She had assumed that the room she woke up in and the larger community area she had found him in was the extent of the place, but she was dead wrong. While those two areas were impressive, she was marveling at the vast nature of the castle she was being led through.

"Yes." Came Kamper's simple answer. She continued to marvel as he brought her into the armory. She looked at weapons for miniature size people to those of giant sized people, leagues larger than herself. But Kamper finally brought her to a stand where a very familiar bow, armor, and arrows were being presented. "Here are your belongings, repaired and restocked."

"You handled MY bow?" she asked in an almost wrathful tone that made her all the more angry that it wasn't effecting him.

"Well, unless you would've preferred it to be broken into pieces and left at the battle site then I would advise gratitude instead of wrath. I didn't have to rescue you, and I was certainly under no obligation to heal you, repair your low grade equipment, or teleport all of it and you here so you could recover in safety." Kamper stated, suddenly very serious.

"Low grade???" She stumbled, she was obviously not accustomed for someone Kamper's sized talking to her like that, nor thinking that her stuff was low grade. She then let her gaze travel to an item that had previously fascinated her. It looked like a strange light in the shape of a spear/sword/ pole hybrid figure. To be honest she thought it looked like a lightning bolt. "What is that?" She asked, still with a bit of arrogance in her voice.

"A master lightning bolt. Haven't perfected it yet. The one who holds it would receive an extremely high authority over lighting and all that it is capable of, as well as becoming immune to lighting of lower proportions." Kamper responded as if he was unimpressed. "It is just a first try at it though, I have yet to perfect that weapon yet."

"Oh..." she answered waveringly, as if she was suddenly struck with a twinge of fear. Obviously she knew of another that could control lightning.

She looked at her things then started to undress to put on her clothes.

"I will leave you to dress and retrieve your things." Kamper said then went out the door, but stopped without looking at the disrobing 'goddess' behind him. "A word of warning though. Do not try to even tough the other things in this room. A high majority of them have minds of their own and loath disrespect, or being handled by anyone besides their chosen masters. You have been warned."

With that Kamper left and waited outside the door. He used his enhance perception to feel what she was doing. Just enough to ensure that she wasn't trying to take any of the things he was keeping in the armory, and thus harming herself. Most of the things could kill her if she decided to test his warning. She got curious and got close to touching a few of them, but in the end didn't. She used some kind of power to resize herself, once she had fully dressed and retrieve her things, then came out to join Kamper.

Without a word he started leading her through the immense halls and rooms. At one point she was at an area overlooking the main hall and throne rooms. She actually gasped at the sight. He led her up and to the shrine exit/entrance at the top. As she exited she seemed to already miss the golden halls in place of the still lovely but less glorious granite room of the shrine at the top of the enormous mountain that she now understood to be his home, and that it was a considerable amount larger on this inside than it appeared on the outside. A very thick and large door shut, closing them off from Kamper's castle once again.

The shrine was one that had Kamper's true form, Death, displayed as well as his close friends and family, as well as a written history of what and who he was in an ancient language of his world. That way, only those 'worthy' could understand how to call out to him if they wanted to meet with him. It acted like a beacon, so if someone was to know what to say and how to say it, he would be physically notified of the fact and be able to teleport back to meet the person. And, like the rest of his castle, it was sized to colossal proportions, and reinforced. Artemis looked around as she reached the entrance and wide open area to which she was visible to the world once again.

"This has been quite interesting, Mortal." She stated, going back to her true size and glowing all the more. Obviously, whatever gave her power was amplified in the wilderness and in the world. Kamper felt that it could be some kind of worship based power. So he held himself back from casting judgment on her. Again, it wasn't his world to judge. But he did want to put one thing straight.

"I wasn't trying to impress. But there is one thing that you should know. You have been calling me 'Mortal' all this time. Yet you have yet to realize the truth." Kamper replied, to which he went to the edge of the mountain top, where the shrine dropped off into the depths below.

"And that would be?" She asked, in a superior tone.

"I am not Mortal." Kamper replied them teleported away from both her and his castle, leaving a very shocked 'goddess'. She was equally shocked to is statement as she was to the fact that his move to teleport was beyond her ability to do or follow.
155321112212.title: She wants her stuff and maybe some answers afte...

choices: One of the gods bother you, again.
1553211122121.content:
“Yes, one apple please.” Kamper replied as he bought some food from a vender in one of the big cities.

He now felt like he was being watched like crazy. He knew that Artemis, where ever she is, was probably observing him and telling the others of what she saw. Kamper had to be extra careful. He had no intension of catching unwanted attention. He avoided fights when he could and when he did need to fight, like with a bandit or something, he made it a believable human level. He also had to keep reminding himself to do things that normal humans did. Like eating and sleeping. While he needed those things, he didn’t need them nearly as much. He was after all human still, just immortal.

“You should pay your respects!” said a random man on the street as Kamper passed a temple. “Zeus is the ruler of us all, and maker of us all!!!”

Kamper only walked passed him and let the man preach to the others that were walking by. Strange enough for how ragged and smelly he was, he convinced over half the people that walked by to go in and worship this ‘Zeus’ and most of the other half had apparently done so earlier. People like him were all over the place. They were like god salesman, or something like that. Kamper found himself wanting to impale a few of them. But he never once bowed in worship of them. He was a Titan, in his realm at least. While it meant something completely different in this realm there was at least one thing that was the same. They nor he would bow in worship to any proclaimed ‘god’.

He eventually went up to a high point of a random but very large city and just meditrained there. It was the only way for him to train without other people seeing, more specifically these ‘gods’ that everyone was talking about. Unlike them however, Kamper could feel them observing… as well as another equally powerful force that he assumed to be this realm’s titans.

“A strange way you choose to spend your time, young one..?” asked a seemingly old man as he approached, then sat next to Kamper on a large rock that acted as a bench.

Kamper could tell right away that this old man was not who he appeared. There was a significant amount of power underneath the disguise of the old man face. Probably one of the gods or titans, disguised so they could walk among humans without drawing attention.

“Meditation and training is a choice of those who value such.” Kamper answered. He wasn’t about to explain the art of meditraining to these gods and titans. He had told himself that he had to put up with them, but he didn’t have to aid them by any means.

“Meditation…? Shouldn’t you be praying to the gods for enlightenment rather than relying on yourself?” The old man asked in a slightly condescending tone, like an old man rebuking a young man, which is what it looked like.

“I bow to no man. Wither he or she goes by the title god, human, titan, or whatever… I certainly pray to the Blessed One, but that is the only one that will receive my prayers, or deserves them.” Kamper replied. He didn’t know much about this realm. But the Blessed One was the god he worshipped in his realm. Creator of everything, and he had to believe that if he created everything, it included this realm. But that was his faith, not to be forced on others, no matter how much he knew it to be true.

“Blessed One? What manner of god is he?” the old man asked.

“The Creator of everything. I don’t mean to be rude, but you can worship your gods and I will worship mine. But I will not say that they are superior to the all powerful god that I believe in.” Kamper replied.

“So, you don’t think the exist?” The old man asked in confusion.

“No, I know they do. For all the talk about these ‘gods’ not interfering in the lives or mortals, they show themselves by their actions all the time. I know they exist and are watching, when they feel like it. But I far from think that they will deserve worship, least of all from me.” Kamper replied.

It looked like the old man was going to blow a gasket. Obviously, whatever god underneath that disguise was not accustomed to such talk from an apparent human.

“You astound me, young man! To have such disrespect for those that gave you life!” He bellowed.

“They didn’t give me life, nor can they take it from me.” Kamper stated, driving the mood of this guy even more sour. “But I tell you what. If they can correctly decipher this symbol, then they will have proven that they are at least competent.”

With that Kamper drew a symbol on the ground. It was his family symbol, but they didn’t know that. It was described on the shrine he had left for people wanting to contact him. So, if they were able to read the shrine and fine him, they would be able to know what they are dealing with, and back off. So telling this test to him wasn’t a useless exercise. With little left to say, the old man stumbled off, very angry. Kamper followed him with his mind for a while until he used some kind of lightning bolt to ride off to the sky.
1553211122121.title: Kamper continues to explore.

15532111221211.content:
Kamper moved around in the cities for a while. He learned a great deal. Not only things that he had yet to experience, which made him a bit sick from time to time cause of his ability, but also info about these ‘gods’ that he was being watched by. He guessed that the one he had talked to with the Old man was Zeus. Artemis was the only other one he had met and it now made sense why he felt her a lot more when he was in the forest between cities. But either way, he was on a road bordering Sparta, which he still didn’t enter. He then heard a scream and a few cries of pain. He went over and saw a battle commencing.

“Come on, form up!” said a voice from the man looking to be the leader. There was only 10 of them, but they were Spartans. They were facing a multiple headed snake looking thing. Kamper wasn’t sure what it was, but it looked advanced and not that easy to defeat for normal humans. Then again, these were Spartans, so maybe they could do it.

“Get him already!” Shouted a voice that seamed familiar voice, but slightly different. He looked at the source and saw a woman that looked very familiar and he soon noticed that it was Alexa. Sure it had been 10 years, but she still looked pretty impressive, then again she was a Spartan, so it fit well.

Kamper leapt up into a tree and watched as the Spartans fought the creature. A few times they managed to cut off a head, only for the creature to grow two more in its place, a few spewing fire and a few other elements. Kamper once again marveled at the skill these Spartans possessed. They didn’t lose a single man as they battled, but they were tiring against the might of this beast. Soon, they could do little more than block against the attacks this beast gave them. With a few more attacks, they were defeated and the beast turned its sights on Alexa, her men not dead but dispatched none the less around the battle field. The beast was now a 25 headed snake looking hybrid.

“You will not find me easy prey!” Alexa boomed as she picked up a sword from the ground. Kamper was impressed by her courage in face of an obviously more powerful enemy that meant to kill her, or possibly worse.

With that, Kamper dropped down behind her and stood with arms crossed behind her so that she didn’t notice he was there, but the beast surely could. Kamper was glaring at the beast so intense that it shivered.

“Ha, that’s right, you know a Spartan is bad news for you don’t you!?” Alexa taunted, which put the beast over the edge.

It was previously deciding wither to heed its instinct and run away from Kamper, or attack. He had already defeated a bunch of Spartans already, so two more humans shouldn’t be a problem, but Kamper was anything but ordinary, and he could feel it through Kamper’s glare. With a hissing roar the beast spewed fire and ice at her while the other heads came forward to press the attack. To her credit, Alexa didn’t flinch, she stood her ground and readied herself for the attack that would undoubtedly leave her a frozen pile of ashes.

With that in mind, Kamper walked past her. She looked surprisingly at him then almost tried to stop him, but by the time she started moving, he was too far away to do much but watch. As he came in contact with the fire and ice he absorbed it, causing a sort of vacuum effect. After which the other heads were still coming. He met the first one with a straight punch. On the outside it looked like he hit the thing and the body exploded. But in actuality he used a sonic strike. A type of attack that shot his energy into another object, person, or in in this case a beast; after his energy was inside, he could do anything he wanted with it, wither it be healing or reducing the organs and bones to mush, then releasing the excess energy… causing an explosion in a direction of his choosing. It was an enhanced ability that he developed and one that not many could follow.

“W… who are you?” Alexa asked as he started walking away. He turned so she could see his face, which actually got her to gasp in shock. “That is impossible. You look just the same.”

Kamper answered her million questions forming in her head by pointing to the ground and used a bit of fire to burn his sign into the ground then vanished from view, just as the other Spartans were getting onto their feet. Kamper knew that they all had seen him do what he did, along with the so called ‘gods’. So sooner or later they would come looking for him. His time of silently exploring was now over. From now on, he would have to be visible to the world as a higher form of power. So the question remained; who would be the first to swallow their pride or embellish their curiosity and come visit him at his shrine?
15532111221211.title: Monster problems.

155321112212111.content:
Kamper knew that he would be unable to travel without being tested and such by the gods since his display in protection of Alexa. As it was he was tested on his way back to his castle. He easily defeated another large beast. So as soon as he got into his castle he took a much needed day off. Then he started improving his castle yet again. Nothing with any point. Just hobbies and whatnot. He liked the idea of something he had back home. In Canas, the sky changed to show the state of affairs in the world. So he did a similar effect in the observation/throne room. He made it so his increased perception could watch things from a considerable distance. After a few more things, he noticed some activity in the shrine at the top of his castle. Someone was trying to figure out his little puzzle.

“It obviously means something!” Bellowed a very large man. Kamper assumed that it was one of the ‘gods’ as he was Artemis’s size, perhaps a bit bigger and had the same type of glowing armor that she was wearing. That and Artemis was there as well, looking at the walls.

“I know it does as well. All I am saying is that this is a language that is unknown to us. However you will find something interesting.” Said the large man that was talking to the one that looked to be in charge.

“What is it?” Came the response.

“While most of our efforts have been useless, there is something that works when we say certain words.” Said the other man to which Artemis came over to observe, as did a few other ‘gods’ that were around. The man gestured to Kamper’s symbol for them to pay attention. “Death.” He spoke and as he did so, the symbol gave off a little bit of Kamper’s Black energy. “It appears that once we get a word right, it shows on the corresponding symbol.”

“But that is the symbol that Kamper said was his.” Artemis replied.

“Then he must have another name. Not surprising, since we each have multiple names that we and mortals used for us. If he is as strong as we are thinking, then there is good reason to have multiple names.” Said yet another large woman other than Artemis.

“Why can’t we just force the door open?!” Boomed a war like person that was obviously having trouble with patience.

“You can try if you want.” Artemis said with a bored tone.

With that the one who suggested it charged at the door and swung a massive sword like weapon at it. The surroundings shuddered with the force he used. Kamper was slightly impressed at the amount of power he had. But the door stood firm, unscratched.

“What! That is impossible!!!” He bellowed and tried striking it again.

“We have all tried, and that door is yet to open. Even if it seems to be the weaker of the two doors, it still won’t budge.” Said the large man in control. “Now, Ares, help us find an actual way in.”

“Is there anything you can tell us about this inside?” One of them asked Artemis.

“It is either made with or overlaid with pure gold. I only saw a fraction of the place, and it is massive. Definitely bigger on the inside as it is on the outside. But most noticeable is his armory.” Artemis responded.

“What do you mean?” Asked the man in charge.

“He fixed my bow and armor like nothing and I swear they work better then before. That and he called them of lower grade. He had some rather impressive weapons and armor in there. He even had a…” She started then stopped, looking at the man in charge nervously.

“What is it?” He asked.

“Zeus, he has, what he calls, a master lightning bolt. I have to say, it… well it looks more impressive than the ones you use.” She said in tones that indicated she didn’t wish to upset him.

“He does?!” Zeus asked in a bit of shock.

“Yes, and he said it wasn’t even done.” She responded.

“All the more reason for us to figure out how to get in.” Zeus said, to which they all redoubled their efforts.
155321112212111.title: The gods.

choices: Kamper wants to live in peace.
He wants a measure of control over them.
1553211122121111.content:
It seemed to take forever. But finally they were able to translate the walls into their language. Good thing too, because the language that Kamper/Death wrote them in was one of great power. But either way, they finally met to deliberate on the matter.

“This is all very disturbing. If this is right, the man inside is not of this world and has more than enough power to destroy not only us but this whole world, if he so wanted.” Said one of them that was identified as Athena.

“Indeed.” Said Zeus.

“Still, he hasn’t shown anything that says he wishes to use his power to rule or anything like that. He even saved my life.” Artemis replied

“Has anyone seen him leave?” Asked Ares.

“No, he is most likely waiting for us to either call on him or move on.” Hermes stated, as he was put in charge of watching the mountain for that express purpose.

“Well, we aren’t going to get any more answers out here. Let’s go in.” Zeus declared then led the way toward the door. “When you knock on Death’s door, Death knocks back.” He recited as the password to open the door. Kamper had used that as more of a door bell. It couldn’t allow passage to anyone, but it did allow him to know that whomever said it was ready to come in.

With that said, Kamper opened the door. The group of ‘gods’ marveled at the sight as they came in. Kamper waited in the throne room, closing off any other passageways so they only had one place to go. He trusted that Artemis would lead them well enough. After all, if these so called ‘gods’ couldn’t even remember the way in and out of a castle like his, then they were more hopeless then he thought. As he guessed, they were able to find their way. They entered the throne room and saw him sitting on his throne.

“It certainly took you long enough.” Kamper stated as they approached, some gripping their weapons and some looking upon him with an arrogant gaze. Only Artemis and Zeus were composed enough to not do either, Artemis because she knew he wouldn’t attack and Zeus by wisdom.

“An impressive castle you have here…” Said Ares, clutching his spear as if itching for a fight. It seemed that he was holding back only for his respect for Zeus, or perhaps fear.

“I worked hard on it.” Kamper stated.

“You built this all by yourself, in ten years?!” Asked Athena.

“Yes.” Kamper answered simply

“That is impossible. Whom else is here?” Asked Ares, which seemed to be the opinion of the rest of them as well, with the acceptation of Artemis and perhaps Zeus.

“Not that it is any of your business…” came a voice as Charity came from a room adjacent to the throne room, and at full size. This made the whole room of ‘gods’ brandish weapons at her and was ready to attack or defend at a moment’s notice. “…I am here, but I had nothing to do with helping him build this place.”

They gave her some distance as she walked over to a seat that materialized beside Kamper. The size difference between the two was enormous, with Charity 500 feet tall and Kamper at about 6 feet tall, but Charity still gave him a bow before sitting down.

“Who are you?” Asked Zeus, as carefully as he was comfortable with.

“I am Charity. My Friend here says that he put a complete history that you must understand before you can come in here. So I assume that just my name will suffice.” Charity answered.

“You are one of his fellow Titans?” Asked Artemis.

“Indeed I am. Now, he has asked me here so that size can no longer be an issue. As you can see, I am much larger than he. Be even in his sealed form, I would never dream of challenging him. So, be careful how you speak, I’ve seen him kill for far less than a simple word and you being all ‘gods’ of this world… it wouldn’t take much for him to slaughter you all.” Charity replied and explained.

“Charity…” Kamper said in a warning.

“What!?! I just wanted them to understand what their position is. If they were on our world, we’d have killed them by now.” Charity replied, to which Kamper just stared up at her until she looked back to the recomposing guests.

“What is it that you want here?” Said Zeus, still keeping his eye on the overly large woman to Kamper’s right.
1553211122121111.title: They get in.

choices: They agree to give him free riegn in their realm.
They won't give him freedom, but will allow for peace.
15532111221211111.content:
“It is quite simple, really, I want to live in peace.” Kamper responded.

“That is a little hard to believe.” Ares replied, twirling his spear with apprehension, and perhaps anxiety.

“Indeed. From your story on the wall, you seem to have an interest in conflict, to a certain degree.” Zeus added.

“That’s hardly fair,” Charity started, to which they all looked up to her. “He helps people out of kindness, not because he likes fighting. While, I admit, he likes a challenge, he doesn’t rule or exert his power over others.”

“But he is your leader, is he not?” Athena asked.

“Did you, or did you not, read our history?” Charity asked.

“Yes.” Another stated.

“Did you see the Titan Tablet?” Charity asked.

“Yes, with Death’s symbol at the top.” Athena responded.

“But you failed to bring the two together.” Charity responded as she nursed what appeared to be the starting of a headache. “You mortals are so frustrating to bring up to speed. Especially the ones that see themselves as gods. Now I understand why we kill gods in our realm…”

“We are not mortal!” Ares blared out, apparently offended.

“Can you die?” Charity asked.

“We can live forever…!” Ares responded, being too heated for a simple glance from Zeus to bring his emotions down.

“That wasn’t the question. The question was… CAN YOU DIE?” She asked, raising her voice a little but calming with one look from Kamper, who was letting them duel it out at the moment.

“Yes, we can.” Zeus responded before Ares could, to which Ares looked at him and Zeus glared at him, backing him down.

“So can I. But it takes more to kill me than it does to kill you. So, in my eyes, you all are the mortals here. Not to mention my friend here.” Charity said, then gestured to Kamper.

“What do you mean?” Artemis asked.

“Simple. He is incapable of dying… or more accurately, staying dead.” Charity stated. “Trust me, for his Titan challenge, all of the rest of the Titans, including ones that are leagues more powerful than I, tried to kill him. He not only defeated us, but an enemy that we were powerless against. To him, we ALL are mortals.”

“But you don’t want to rule us?” Zeus asked Kamper directly, to which he just received a nod. “What is it that you want then?”

“Peace and Freedom.” Kamper said in a simple response.

“What he means by that is…” Charity started as she saw their confused faces. “That he wants to avoid conflict as much as he can. But if he decides he wants to do something, then he doesn’t want to jump through your rules to do it. You let him do what he wants, when he wants, and require nothing from him. It would also help that you give him some respect. He generally gets what he goes after.”
15532111221211111.title: Kamper wants to live in peace.

155321112212111111.content:
“So, you want to do as you wish and not be attacked?” Zeus asked.

“Not really.” Kamper responded, making them confused.

“What he wants…” Started Charity, yet again.

“Can’t he talk for himself?” Asked Artemis, but almost instantly regretted her outburst as Charity looked at her with an annoyed expression. Someone over 3 times her size would have that effect.

“He can, he just prefers to act rather than talk. Would you rather him beat the stuffing out of you to make his point?” She asked rhetorically, then continued… “… Anyway… what he wants is for him to not be pursued for one reason or another. While he prefers not to fight, he also enjoys stretching his muscles… which might be at the expense of any who are stupid enough to attack him. But there is one thing he tends to go overboard in…”

“Which is?” Zeus asked, obviously wondering what could make a force like Kamper/Death to react in a way that could threaten him or his fellow ‘gods’.

“Well, if someone or something were to threaten something he values… he… well no one has been able to threaten or bribe him before… and live to tell about it.” Charity answered, earning a few gulps from those around in the ‘god’ crowd.

“Would you side with this realm’s Titans?” Zeus asked, almost nervously at this point.

“If they had a good reason.” Kamper asked.

“Good reason?” Zeus asked.

“Like a heavily injured young lady that is begging for mercy… I would help them. Like Artemis was.” Kamper responded, which cause a few looks and a blush from Artemis.

“So, if they are not noble and we are then…” Athena started to ask.

“Did you not hear him?” Charity asked with annoyance. “He will do what he wishes, which is on the side of the morally good. Regardless who is doing the evil, he will probably fight them.”

“Ok, that makes sense.” Zeus said, hoping the look of their group to improve in Kamper/Death’s eyes. “My I ask for a favor?”

“Speak.” Kamper agreed.

“Will you show us your Death form, so we know who you are?” Zeus asked.

The room became insanely heavy and they all dropped to their knees, some to the floor with the amount of power Kamper was expelling. It seemed that they were now regretting their request. Charity was looking down with favor and amusement. Kamper slowly began to change, to the astonished gaze of the ‘gods’. It was as if the shadows in the room was eating at Kamper’s form until a 10 foot frame of Death was gazing at them idly. Static discharges the size of lightning bolts, black flames eating parts of the floor, and water in dishes were being carried through the room. Showing that he had power over every element they knew and didn’t know about. When he saw that they were about to pass out, he dialed it down and sat on the throne with the room back to normal, as Kamper, as if nothing was happening or happened.

“That was his full power, your full power???” Zeus asked with disbelief, that only got Charity to start laughing. “What???”

“That… that was his minimal power in his released form. By the looks of things, you mortals wouldn’t be able to survive if he went any higher.” She stated to their disbelief. “Again, I’ve seen him at full power… believe me when I say, never wish for that. I’ve never been so scared in all my life. For your sakes, I think he will probably remain in his sealed form.”

“You will?” Zeus asked, or more like begged.

“I will do as I must.” Kamper responded.

At this point, especially in the aftermath of what they just saw, they took every word as very vital. Perhaps seeing just the sight of Death to be more than enough to illustrate that they were not to piss off this Titan. A new found respect had even the warring Ares a very hesitant man. Mere men is what they were compared to him, perhaps lower. It was very unlikely that they would move to anger this new addition to their realm. And they prayed… to whom they didn’t know, that he didn’t choose the side of their realm’s titans against them.
155321112212111111.title: They agree to give him free riegn in their realm.

choices: There are a few that abuse the power.
1553211122121111111.content:
“Good. Thank you, Charity.” Kamper said as they agreed and were inlightened.

“Any time…” She said, then walked into the room behind the throne, where Kamper had put a portal system for his friends to visit. Sadly, he couldn’t use it to get home, but they could come visit for very short periods of time. Soon the thunderous booms of her footfalls had disappeared and Kamper got up, earning a bow or two from the observing gods.

“Come with me, please.” Kamper requested then led the group out into the hallway.

He wound down the vast hallways with them following, talking and discussing different aspects of what just happened. It wasn’t until about 15 minutes of walking that the issue of where they were going came up.

“Artemis, where is he taking us?” Zeus asked.

“I could be mistaken, but he could be taking us to his Armory. It is this way, or I’m pretty sure it was in this direction…” Artemis answered.

She was right. Kamper led them into the armory and they gawked at many of the weapons in the room. None were anything less than master pieces. Despite their gawking, they followed Kamper until he led them to a row of weapons that had some of their names next to the weapon.

“This is my gift to you all, for being civil. I have upgraded your… inferior weapons.” Kamper stated as he gestured to the weapons.

Zeus was first in stepping forward toward the case with his name and presumed weapon in it. A finished Master Lightning bolt sat in the case, sparking and whirring in potentially violent patterns. He hesitated then reached out and grabbed the bolt. There was an immediate power surge through him and lighting began flowing around the room, then it seemed to seep into his body and the bolt that he now held.

“So much power…!” Zeus stated, this got the other gods to grab their own assigned weapons. Each of them had a like experience when they grabbed hold of their weapons. Poseidon had a surge of water that almost collided with Zeus’ lighting, but they were able to control their weapons good enough. “You are just giving us this much power?”

“I understand your rolls good enough. I will trust that you will not abuse the power I’ve given you… and realize that I command a stronger power than the ones I’ve given to you all. Do not test me in the future and be worthy of the power I’ve given you. If I find that giving you power was a mistake, I WILL take it away.” Kamper responded.

“And what do we do with our old weapons?” Athena asked.

“Whatever you want. Maybe put them in the reach of men so they can do quests for them. Either way, the weapons I’ve given to you is over 10 – 100 times the power of the ones you used to have. But it is up to you.” Kamper responded.

“Are you going to give weapon upgrades to our realm’s Titans as well?” Zeus asked, then the others turned to see what Kamper’s answer was. They had forgot that he could just as easily give them equally superior weapons.

“Perhaps… If the prove themselves worthy. Thus far, they have far from impressed me.”
Kamper responded. They all seemed to be glad of that and would go off and decide what they should do with this new found power they had received…
1553211122121111111.title: He gives them gifts

15532111221211111111.content:
Kamper was slightly surprised when the ‘gods’ didn’t misuse their power. He saw a generous amount of testing of their new found abilities, but they didn’t go on a Titan killing spree, or force their will on the kingdoms of men. They did, however, answer the prayers that they were given on occasion. When people paid homage to Zeus, for example, he helped them in ways that included sending a lightning bolt down to defeat an enemy that was rather vile. But they were always weary of Kamper, as he started to walk among men again. They rarely used their power in a manner that could be looked at as arrogant or ‘godlike’. The only exception to this was when a titan picked a fight with them. They would soundly defeat the offending titan, but not by any means go looking for Titans to kill. They also stopped testing Kamper with mythical beasts from their domains. They also seemed to understand, that if Kamper wanted to interfere with Man, then he could. They would not move to stop him, even if they wanted to, which they didn’t.

“Get out!” Hollered a priest as he instructed the guards of temple area to throw Kamper out of it. He had been just passing by, taking a moment to evaluate the statue that the other humans were worshiping. It was a 200 foot tall version of Zeus, overlaid with gold and holding a large lightning bolt in his hand. When he was approached and ordered to kneel to the figure for worship, he refused. To which they promptly threw him out of the temple.

“I’m sorry…” Said a beggar looking old man that Kamper had landed next to as the priest and guards made their way back inside.

“It was not your doing.” Kamper responded as he got up and sat on a ledge facing the temple, to which the old man bowed to him then took a seat next to him.

“But it was my followers, at my temple.” The old man, said. The statement alone would be enough for a normal man to deduce that he was Zeus, apologizing for being any part of an attack on Kamper. Of course, Kamper already knew that and who he was.

“But not you. They are merely doing what they’ve been raised to do. I can’t fault them for it, or you.” Kamper responded.

“Your mercy knows no bounds. If you were a lesser person, you could very easily punish them for their insolence, and me for not teaching them as they should.” Zeus complimented.

“It is not mercy. Your affairs and that of this world are for you and the governing powers to decide on. I am merely passing through. I care not for a few misguided fools or their actions.” Kamper responded.

“Then, if I may ask, why haven’t you entered Sparta? They would definitely have less ‘fools’ there to bother you. It would no doubt be a more pleasant place to live for one such as you.” Zeus inquired.

“That is simple. I gave Sparta my word that I would not enter it. So, I won’t.” Kamper responded.

“I see.” Zeus answered. Kamper could tell that Zeus didn’t really get it. As a ‘god’, he enjoyed the freedom of going anywhere he pleased. “You know…? Ares could send them to your home… Sparta worships him as the ‘god of war’. If he were to drop a few hints as signs from above, they could be enticed to seek you out…?”

“Do as you wish.” Kamper responded.

“Do you wish for anything?” Zeus asked.

“Not at the moment.” Kamper responded simply.

“… Pride is a formidable companion…!” Zeus complimented as he spotted Pride in the air above city, also hoping to change to a different topic.

“Indeed. Is he causing problems?” Kamper asked.

“Oh, not at all. He often flies around Mount Olympus and perches in some of the best places this world has to offer. We are glad to have him around. Although, he did get attacked by a titan a few weeks ago…” Zeus responded.

“Not the most wise move…” Kamper replied.

“Not at all. The offending titan didn’t last long enough for any one of us gods to render aid.” Zeus agreed.
